   20: 
   21: -module(guard_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          bad_arith/1, bad_tuple/1,
   25: 	 test_heap_guards/1, guard_bifs/1,
   26: 	 type_tests/1,guard_bif_binary_part/1]).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: 
   30: -export([init/3]).
   31: -import(lists, [member/2]).
   32: 
   33: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   34: 
   35: all() -> 
   36:     [bad_arith, bad_tuple, test_heap_guards, guard_bifs,
   37:      type_tests, guard_bif_binary_part].
   38: 
   39: 
   40: %% Test that a bad arithmetic operation in a guard works correctly.
   41: bad_arith(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   42:     5 = bad_arith1(2, 3),
   43:     10 = bad_arith1(1, infinity),
   44:     10 = bad_arith1(infinity, 1),
   45:     ok.
   46: 
   47: bad_arith1(T1, T2) when T1+T2 < 10 ->
   48:     T1+T2;
   49: bad_arith1(_, _) ->
   50:     10.
   51: 
   52: %% Test that bad arguments to element/2 are handled correctly.
   53: bad_tuple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   54:     error = bad_tuple1(a),
   55:     error = bad_tuple1({a, b}),
   56:     x = bad_tuple1({x, b}),
   57:     y = bad_tuple1({a, b, y}),
   58:     ok.
   59: 
   60: bad_tuple1(T) when element(1, T) == x ->
   61:     x;
   62: bad_tuple1(T) when element(3, T) == y ->
   63:     y;
   64: bad_tuple1(_) ->
   65:     error.
   66: 
   67: test_heap_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
   69:     
   70:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   71:     Tuple = {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx},
   72:     List = [a, list, is, built, here],
   73: 
   74:     'try'(fun a_case/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
   75:     'try'(fun a_case/1, [List], [List, List]),
   76:     'try'(fun a_case/1, [a], [a]),
   77: 
   78:     'try'(fun an_if/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
   79:     'try'(fun an_if/1, [List], [List, List]),
   80:     'try'(fun an_if/1, [a], [a]),
   81: 
   82:     'try'(fun receive_test/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
   83:     'try'(fun receive_test/1, [List], [List, List]),
   84:     'try'(fun receive_test/1, [a], [a]),
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: a_case(V) ->
   88:     case V of
   89: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
   90: 	    [T];
   91: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
   92: 	    [L, L];
   93: 	a ->
   94: 	    [a]
   95:     end.
   96: 
   97: an_if(V) ->
   98:     if
   99: 	V == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  100: 	    [V];
  101: 	V == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  102: 	    [V, V];
  103: 	V == a ->
  104: 	    [a]
  105:     end.
  106: 
  107: receive_test(V) ->
  108:     self() ! V,
  109:     a_receive().
  110: 
  111: a_receive() ->
  112:     receive
  113: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  114: 	    [T];
  115: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  116: 	    [L, L];
  117: 	a ->
  118: 	    [a]
  119:     end.
  120: 
  121: 'try'(Fun, Args, Result) ->
  122:     'try'(512, Fun, Args, Result, []).
  123: 
  124: 'try'(0, _, _, _, _) ->
  125:     ok;
  126: 'try'(Iter, Fun, Args, Result, Filler) ->
  127:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, init, [Fun,Args,list_to_tuple(Filler)]),
  128:     receive
  129: 	{'EXIT', Pid, {result, Result}} ->
  130: 	    'try'(Iter-1, Fun, Args, Result, [0|Filler]);
  131: 	{result, Other} ->
  132: 	    ct:fail("Expected ~p; got ~p~n", [Result, Other]);
  133: 	Other ->
  134: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  135:     end.
  136: 
  137: init(Fun, Args, Filler) ->
  138:     Result = {result,apply(Fun, Args)},
  139:     dummy(Filler),
  140:     exit(Result).
  141: 
  142: dummy(_) ->
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: -define(MASK_ERROR(EXPR),mask_error((catch (EXPR)))).
  146: mask_error({'EXIT',{Err,_}}) ->
  147:     Err;
  148: mask_error(Else) ->
  149:     Else.
  150: 
  151: %% Test the binary_part/2,3 guard BIF's extensively
  152: guard_bif_binary_part(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     %% Overflow tests that need to be unoptimized
  154:     badarg =
  155: 	?MASK_ERROR(
  156: 	   binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,{16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF,
  157: 				 -16#7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF-1})),
  158:     badarg =
  159: 	?MASK_ERROR(
  160: 	   binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,{16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF,
  161: 				 16#7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF})),
  162:     F = fun(X) ->
  163: 		Master = self(),
  164: 		{Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor( fun() ->
  165: 					     A = lists:duplicate(X,a),
  166: 					     B = [do_binary_part_guard() | A],
  167: 					     Master ! {self(),hd(B)},
  168: 					     ok
  169: 				     end),
  170: 		receive
  171: 		    {Pid,ok} ->
  172: 			erlang:demonitor(Ref,[flush]),
  173: 			ok;
  174: 		    Error ->
  175: 			Error
  176: 		end
  177: 	end,
  178:     [ ok = F(N) || N <- lists:seq(1,10000) ],
  179:     ok.
  180: 
  181: 
  182: do_binary_part_guard() ->
  183:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>),
  184:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>),
  185:     error = bptest(<<1>>),
  186:     error = bptest(<<>>),
  187:     error = bptest(apa),
  188:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>),
  189:     % With one variable (pos)
  190:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1),
  191:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1),
  192:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1),
  193:     error = bptest(<<>>,1),
  194:     error = bptest(apa,1),
  195:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1),
  196:     % With one variable (length)
  197:     1 = bptesty(<<1,2,3>>,1),
  198:     2 = bptesty(<<2,1,3>>,1),
  199:     error = bptesty(<<1>>,1),
  200:     error = bptesty(<<>>,1),
  201:     error = bptesty(apa,1),
  202:     3 = bptesty(<<2,3,3>>,2),
  203:     % With one variable (whole tuple)
  204:     1 = bptestx(<<1,2,3>>,{1,1}),
  205:     2 = bptestx(<<2,1,3>>,{1,1}),
  206:     error = bptestx(<<1>>,{1,1}),
  207:     error = bptestx(<<>>,{1,1}),
  208:     error = bptestx(apa,{1,1}),
  209:     3 = bptestx(<<2,3,3>>,{1,2}),
  210:     % With two variables
  211:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
  212:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
  213:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1,1),
  214:     error = bptest(<<>>,1,1),
  215:     error = bptest(apa,1,1),
  216:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
  217:     % Direct (autoimported) call, these will be evaluated by the compiler...
  218:     <<2>> = binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
  219:     <<1>> = binary_part(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
  220:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
  221:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<1>>,1,1)),
  222:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<>>,1,1)),
  223:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(apa,1,1)),
  224:     <<3,3>> = binary_part(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
  225:     % Direct call through apply
  226:     <<2>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1,2,3>>,1,1]),
  227:     <<1>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,1,3>>,1,1]),
  228:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
  229:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1>>,1,1])),
  230:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<>>,1,1])),
  231:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[apa,1,1])),
  232:     <<3,3>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,3,3>>,1,2]),
  233:     % Constant propagation
  234:      Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
  235:      ok = if
  236: 		    binary_part(Bin,1,1) =:= <<2>> ->
  237: 			ok;
  238: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
  239: 		    true ->
  240: 			error
  241: 		end,
  242:      ok = if
  243: 		    binary_part(Bin,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
  244: 			ok;
  245: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
  246: 		    true ->
  247: 			error
  248: 		end,
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: 
  252: bptest(B) when length(B) =:= 1337 ->
  253:     1;
  254: bptest(B) when binary_part(B,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
  255:     1;
  256: bptest(B) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,1) =:= <<1>> ->
  257:     2;
  258: bptest(B)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
  259:     3;
  260: bptest(_) ->
  261:     error.
  262: 
  263: bptest(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
  264:     1;
  265: bptest(B,A) when binary_part(B,{A,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
  266:     1;
  267: bptest(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,1) =:= <<1>> ->
  268:     2;
  269: bptest(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
  270:     3;
  271: bptest(_,_) ->
  272:     error.
  273: 
  274: bptestx(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
  275:     1;
  276: bptestx(B,A) when binary_part(B,A) =:= <<2>> ->
  277:     1;
  278: bptestx(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<1>> ->
  279:     2;
  280: bptestx(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<3,3>> ->
  281:     3;
  282: bptestx(_,_) ->
  283:     error.
  284: 
  285: bptesty(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
  286:     1;
  287: bptesty(B,A) when binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<2>> ->
  288:     1;
  289: bptesty(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,A) =:= <<1>> ->
  290:     2;
  291: bptesty(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
  292:     3;
  293: bptesty(_,_) ->
  294:     error.
  295: 
  296: bptest(B,A,_C) when length(B) =:= A ->
  297:     1;
  298: bptest(B,A,C) when binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<2>> ->
  299:     1;
  300: bptest(B,A,C) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,C) =:= <<1>> ->
  301:     2;
  302: bptest(B,A,C)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
  303:     3;
  304: bptest(_,_,_) ->
  305:     error.
  306: 
  307: 
  308: %% Test all guard bifs with nasty (but legal arguments).
  309: guard_bifs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     Big = -237849247829874297658726487367328971246284736473821617265433,
  311:     Float = 387924.874,
  312: 
  313:     %% Succeeding use of guard bifs.
  314: 
  315:     try_gbif('abs/1', Big, -Big),
  316:     try_gbif('float/1', Big, float(Big)),
  317:     try_gbif('float/1', Big, float(id(Big))),
  318:     try_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 387924.0),
  319:     try_gbif('round/1', Float, 387925.0),
  320:     try_gbif('round/1', 6209607916799025.0, 6209607916799025),
  321:     try_gbif('length/1', [], 0),
  322: 
  323:     try_gbif('length/1', [a], 1),
  324:     try_gbif('length/1', [a, b], 2),
  325:     try_gbif('length/1', lists:seq(0, 31), 32),
  326: 
  327:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a], a),
  328:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a, b], a),
  329: 
  330:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a], []),
  331:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b], [b]),
  332:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b, c], [b, c]),
  333: 
  334:     try_gbif('size/1', {}, 0),
  335:     try_gbif('size/1', {a}, 1),
  336:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b}, 2),
  337:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b, c}, 3),
  338:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([]), 0),
  339:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1]), 1),
  340:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2]), 2),
  341:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2, 3]), 3),
  342: 
  343:     try_gbif('bit_size/1', <<0:7>>, 7),
  344: 
  345:     try_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, x}),
  346:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {1, x}),
  347:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {2, y}),
  348: 
  349:     try_gbif('self/0', 0, self()),
  350:     try_gbif('node/0', 0, node()),
  351:     try_gbif('node/1', self(), node()),
  352: 
  353:     %% Failing use of guard bifs.
  354: 
  355:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', Big, 1),
  356:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', [], 1),
  357: 
  358:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', Big, 42),
  359:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', [], 42),
  360: 
  361:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 0.0),
  362:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', [], 0.0),
  363: 
  364:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', Float, 1.0),
  365:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', [], a),
  366: 
  367:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [], 1),
  368:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [a], 0),
  369:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', a, 0),
  370:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', {a}, 0),
  371: 
  372:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [], 0),
  373:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [a], x),
  374:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', x, x),
  375: 
  376:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [], 0),
  377:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [a], x),
  378:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', x, x),
  379: 
  380:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', {}, 1),
  381:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [], 0),
  382:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [a], 1),
  383:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', fun() -> 1 end, 0),
  384:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', fun() -> 1 end, 1),
  385: 
  386:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {}, {1, x}),
  387:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, y}),
  388:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', [], {1, z}),
  389: 
  390:     try_fail_gbif('self/0', 0, list_to_pid("<0.0.0>")),
  391:     try_fail_gbif('node/0', 0, xxxx),
  392:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', self(), xxx),
  393:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', yyy, xxx),
  394: 
  395:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} = catch gh_6634({a,b}),
  396:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} = catch gh_6634(42),
  397: 
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: gh_6634(X) when is_tuple(X) andalso not ok ->
  401:     %% `not ok` would be translated to an is_eq_exact instruction,
  402:     %% which the JIT would not handle correctly because it had two
  403:     %% immediate operands. In a release build incorrect code would be
  404:     %% generated, which might crash the runtime system; in a debug
  405:     %% build an assertion would fire at load time.
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: try_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  409:     case guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  410: 	{Id, X, Y} ->
  411: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id, X, Y]);
  412: 	Other ->
  413:             ct:fail("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n", [Id, X, Y, Other])
  414:     end.
  415: 
  416: try_fail_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  417:     case catch guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  418: 	{'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,guard_bif,[Id,X,Y],_}|_]}} ->
  419: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id,X,Y]);
  420: 	Other ->
  421:             ct:fail("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n", [Id, X, Y, Other])
  422:     end.
  423: 
  424: guard_bif('abs/1', X, Y) when abs(X) == Y ->
  425:     {'abs/1', X, Y};
  426: guard_bif('float/1', X, Y) when float(X) == Y ->
  427:     {'float/1', X, Y};
  428: guard_bif('trunc/1', X, Y) when trunc(X) == Y ->
  429:     {'trunc/1', X, Y};
  430: guard_bif('round/1', X, Y) when round(X) == Y ->
  431:     {'round/1', X, Y};
  432: guard_bif('length/1', X, Y) when length(X) == Y ->
  433:     {'length/1', X, Y};
  434: guard_bif('hd/1', X, Y) when hd(X) == Y ->
  435:     {'hd/1', X, Y};
  436: guard_bif('tl/1', X, Y) when tl(X) == Y ->
  437:     {'tl/1', X, Y};
  438: guard_bif('size/1', X, Y) when size(X) == Y ->
  439:     {'size/1', X, Y};
  440: guard_bif('bit_size/1', X, Y) when bit_size(X) == Y ->
  441:     {'bit_size/1', X, Y};
  442: guard_bif('element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}) when element(Pos, X) == Expected ->
  443:     {'element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}};
  444: guard_bif('self/0', X, Y) when self() == Y ->
  445:     {'self/0', X, Y};
  446: guard_bif('node/0', X, Y) when node() == Y ->
  447:     {'node/0', X, Y};
  448: guard_bif('node/1', X, Y) when node(X) == Y ->
  449:     {'node/1', X, Y}.
  450: 
  451: %% Test the type tests.
  452: type_tests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  453:     Types = all_types(),
  454:     Tests = type_test_desc(),
  455:     put(errors, 0),
  456:     put(violations, 0),
  457:     type_tests(Tests, Types),
  458:     case {get(errors), get(violations)} of
  459: 	      {0, 0} ->
  460: 		  ok;
  461: 	      {0, N} ->
  462: 		  {comment, integer_to_list(N) ++ " standard violation(s)"};
  463: 	      {Errors, Violations} ->
  464: 		  ct:fail("~p sub test(s) failed, ~p violation(s)", [Errors, Violations])
  465: 	  end.
  466: 
  467: type_tests([{Test, AllowedTypes}| T], AllTypes) ->
  468:     type_tests(Test, AllTypes, AllowedTypes),
  469:     type_tests(T, AllTypes);
  470: type_tests([], _) ->
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: type_tests(Test, [Type|T], Allowed) ->
  474:     {TypeTag, Value} = Type,
  475:     case member(TypeTag, Allowed) of
  476: 	true ->
  477: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  478: 		Test ->
  479: 		    ok;
  480: 		_Other ->
  481: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) failed", [Test, Value]),
  482: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  483: 	    end;
  484: 	false ->
  485: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  486: 		{'EXIT',{function_clause,
  487: 			 [{?MODULE,type_test,[Test,Value],Loc}|_]}}
  488: 		when is_list(Loc) ->
  489: 		    ok;
  490: 		{'EXIT',Other} ->
  491: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_error_reason,Other});
  492: 		tuple when is_function(Value) ->
  493: 		    io:format("Standard violation: Test ~p(~p) should fail",
  494: 			      [Test, Value]),
  495: 		    put(violations, get(violations) + 1);
  496: 		_Other ->
  497: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) succeeded (should fail)", [Test, Value]),
  498: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  499: 	    end
  500:     end,
  501:     type_tests(Test, T, Allowed);
  502: type_tests(_, [], _) ->
  503:     ok.
  504: 
  505: all_types() ->
  506:     [{small, 42},
  507:      {big, 392742928742947293873938792874019287447829874290742},
  508:      {float, 3.14156},
  509:      {nil, []},
  510:      {cons, [a]},
  511:      {tuple, {a, b}},
  512:      {atom, xxxx},
  513:      {ref, make_ref()},
  514:      {pid, self()},
  515:      {port, make_port()},
  516:      {function, fun(_) -> "" end},
  517:      {function, fun erlang:abs/1},
  518:      {binary, list_to_binary([])},
  519:      {bitstring, <<0:7>>}].
  520: 
  521: type_test_desc() ->
  522:     [{binary, [binary]},
  523:      {bitstring, [binary, bitstring]},
  524:      {integer, [small, big]},
  525:      {float, [float]},
  526:      {number, [small, big, float]},
  527:      {atom, [atom]},
  528:      {list, [cons, nil]},
  529:      {nonempty_list, [cons]},
  530:      {nil, [nil]},
  531:      {tuple, [tuple]},
  532:      {pid, [pid]},
  533:      {port, [port]},
  534:      {reference, [ref]},
  535:      {function, [function]}].
  536: 
  537: type_test(integer, X) when is_integer(X) ->
  538:     integer;
  539: type_test(float, X) when is_float(X) ->
  540:     float;
  541: type_test(number, X) when is_number(X) ->
  542:     number;
  543: type_test(atom, X) when is_atom(X) ->
  544:     atom;
  545: type_test(list, X) when is_list(X) ->
  546:     list;
  547: type_test(nonempty_list, [_]) ->
  548:     nonempty_list;
  549: type_test(nil, []) ->
  550:     nil;
  551: type_test(tuple, X) when is_tuple(X) ->
  552:     tuple;
  553: type_test(pid, X) when is_pid(X) ->
  554:     pid;
  555: type_test(reference, X) when is_reference(X) ->
  556:     reference;
  557: type_test(port, X) when is_port(X) ->
  558:     port;
  559: type_test(binary, X) when is_binary(X) ->
  560:     binary;
  561: type_test(bitstring, X) when is_bitstring(X) ->
  562:     bitstring;
  563: type_test(function, X) when is_function(X) ->
  564:     function.
  565: 
  566: make_port() ->
  567:     hd(erlang:ports()).
  568: 
  569: id(I) -> I.
